intro: Lagenophora cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
